bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Mazyck P. Ravenel, July 12, 1932

div1.p: Carter thanks Ravenel for his review of the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Mazyck P. Ravenel, July 12, 1932
div1.opener:
Carbon Ravenel, Mazÿck
4 Clarendon Avenue,
Colonial Hills, Route 3,
Birmingham, Alabama,
July 12, 1932.
Dear Doctor Ravenel:
div1.p:
It is only recently, through the thoughtful-
ness of Dr. Russell, that I have seen your review
of Father's book on Yellow Fever. This, in a
clipping from the American Journal of Public
Health for December, 1931.

May I take this opportunity to tell you
how deeply I appreciate your very complete appre-
ciation of the book, and of its author? I know of
no one whose opinion Father valued more than your
own, nor one on whose friendship he set greater
store! I feel then that it is the name of “the
Carters” rather than of “this poore remnant of
a greate Fellowship” that I thank you--from the
bottom of my heart!--for a very perfect Thing--
perfectly done!
div1.closer:
Most truly and gratefully yours, Laura Armistead Carter Dr. Mazÿck P. Ravenel,
Professor of Medical Bacteriology, and Preventive
Medicine,
University of Missouri,
Columbia, Missouri.
